intro: Isotropis petrensis, commonly known as the Petren's isotropis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
